column4: No.  It just means the kernel module you tried to load doesn't exist.
i just reloaded the synaptic packages, and all are already installed, or at least thats what the terminal said

Well, your system didn't find that kernel module so it complained. Whatever the reason it's not there, I don't know.  But you were worried that your wireless interface had, "died" and I was only letting you know that the error you saw was not trying to tell you that! :)
Are you following the info listed here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx
yes that is the link i was following

also I should make you aware that my wireless card was 'having issues' prior to Ubuntu install.  im running an hp:dv2000, had the MB replaced by HP [faulty; were under a law suit] and the wireless card was intermittent at the time but wasnt covered and was expensive so i opted to deal with intermittent.  I installed Ubuntu because Windows Vista had a Windows Virus.
